text: The men's lightweight coxless pair competition at the 2019 World Rowing Championships took place at the Linz-Ottensheim regatta venue. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Monday 26 August 2019 || 11:27 || Heats |- | Wednesday 28 August 2019 || 15:58 || Repechage |- | rowspan=2|Friday 30 August 2019 || 10:10 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 15:03 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Heats=== Heat winners advanced directly to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the repechage. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Giuseppe Di Mare Raffaele Serio | align="left"| | 6:41.54 | FA |- | 2 | align="left"|Vangelys Pereira Emanuel Borges | align="left"| | 6:49.05 | R |- | 3 | align="left"|Bence Szabó Kálmán Furkó | align="left"| | 7:09.85 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Paylak Mirzoyan Mher Janikyan | align="left"| | 7:40.99 | R |} ====Heat 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Jiří Kopáč Jan Hajek | align="left"| | 6:52.80 | FA |- | 2 | align="left"|Nikita Bolozin Maksim Telitcyn | align="left"| | 6:54.25 | R |- | 3 | align="left"|James Nelson Alex Twist | align="left"| | 7:00.69 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Markus Lemp Anton Sigl | align="left"| | 7:26.12 | R |} ===Repechage=== The four fastest boats advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Vangelys Pereira Emanuel Borges | align="left"| | 6:48.50 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Nikita Bolozin Maksim Telitcyn | align="left"| | 6:51.37 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Bence Szabó Kálmán Furkó | align="left"| | 6:52.88 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 4 | align="left"|Markus Lemp Anton Sigl | align="left"| | 6:56.90 | FA |- | 5 | align="left"|James Nelson Alex Twist | align="left"| | 6:58.31 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Paylak Mirzoyan Mher Janikyan | align="left"| | 7:37.29 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the B final. ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|James Nelson Alex Twist | align="left"| | 7:00.45 |- | 2 | align="left"|Paylak Mirzoyan Mher Janikyan | align="left"| | 7:32.97 |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Giuseppe Di Mare Raffaele Serio | align="left"| | 6:37.75 |- | | align="left"|Nikita Bolozin Maksim Telitsyn | align="left"| | 6:42.07 |- | | align="left"|Vangelys Pereira Emanuel Borges | align="left"| | 6:45.28 |- | 4 | align="left"|Bence Szabó Kálmán Furkó | align="left"| | 6:49.50 |- | 5 | align="left"|Nikita Bolozin Aleksei Kiiashko | align="left"| | 6:55.34 |- | 6 | align="left"|Markus Lemp Anton Sigl | align="left"| | 7:03.70 |} ==References== Category:2019 World Rowing Championships
title: 2019 World Rowing Championships – Men's lightweight coxless pair
